title: Crater Lake National Park: History & Culture
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture             History & Culture         Searching through the archives can yield documents, images and artifacts over a hundred years old. Crater Lake Museum & Archives Collection  Crater Lake has long attracted the wonder and admiration of people all over the world. Its depth of 1,943 feet (592 meters) makes it the deepest lake in the United States, and the ninth deepest in the world. Its fresh water is some of the clearest found anywhere in the world. The interaction of people with this place is traceable at least as far back as the eruption of Mount Mazama. Founded May 22, 1902, Crater Lake National Park seeks to preserve these natural and cultural resources. For more information on research and using the Crater Lake Museum & Archives collection, click here. Learn more about the history and culture associated with Crater Lake by visiting our brochures page.
